syntax-highlight-everything.title: Syntax Highlight Everything
syntax-highlight-everything.author: kennethormandy
syntax-highlight-everything.desc: In this lightning talk, Kenneth introduces developers to the subtle, advanced typographic features that highlight syntaxes beyond code.

seattle-startup-week.title: Building, Deploying, and Scaling Node.js Apps / Seattle Startup Week
seattle-startup-week.author: sintaxi
seattle-startup-week.desc: As part of Seattle Startup Week, the Seattle Node.js Meetup is going to hold a very special evening focused on Node.js in production with talks and panel discussion.

brian-and-brocks-app-adventure-2.title: Brian and Brock’s App Adventure
brian-and-brocks-app-adventure-2.author: sintaxi
brian-and-brocks-app-adventure-2.desc:
The mobile web has moved at a breakneck pace the last couple years. With the development of ES6, client-side module loading, package management, and pre-compilers quickly becoming the norm, its becoming increasingly difficult to keep up.
In this 2 part session, Brian LeRoux and Brock Whitten will unlock the deepest secrets of the illusive “asset pipeline” and what you need to know to take your next steps into the emerging world of the mobile web.

efficient-web-type-c-1556-3.title: Efficient Web Type, c. 1556
efficient-web-type-c-1556-3.author: kennethormandy
efficient-web-type-c-1556-3.desc: This talk draws draws from a 450 year-old lessons of efficient type design, and introduces the practical improvements the Web Open Font Format 2.0 will bring to designers and developers.

efficient-web-type-c-1556-2.title: Efficient Web Type, c. 1556
efficient-web-type-c-1556-2.author: kennethormandy
efficient-web-type-c-1556-2.desc: This version of Efficient Web Type, c. 1556 draws from a 450 year-old lessons of efficient type design, and introduces the practical improvements the Web Open Font Format 2.0 will bring to designers and developers.

brian-and-brocks-app-adventure.title: Brian and Brock’s App Adventure
brian-and-brocks-app-adventure.author: sintaxi
brian-and-brocks-app-adventure.desc: In this two-part session, Adobe PhoneGap lead Brian LeRoux, and PhoneGap co-creator Brock Whitten, will unlock the deepest secrets of the illusive “asset pipeline” and what you need to know to take your next steps into the emerging world of the mobile web.

efficient-web-type-c-1556-1.title: Efficient Web Type, c. 1556
efficient-web-type-c-1556-1.author: kennethormandy
efficient-web-type-c-1556-1.desc: This talk draws draws from a 450 year-old lessons of efficient type design, and introduces the practical improvements the Web Open Font Format 2.0 will bring to designers and developers.

flexbox-and-what-you-can-do-with-it.title: Flexbox and what you can do with it
flexbox-and-what-you-can-do-with-it.author: jorgepedret
flexbox-and-what-you-can-do-with-it.desc: Jorge will give a quick introduction to the CSS Flexbox, covering subjects like browser support, as well as when and when not to use them.

lessons-learned-building-the-harp-platfo.title: Lessons learned building the Harp Platform
lessons-learned-building-the-harp-platfo.author: sintaxi
lessons-learned-building-the-harp-platfo.desc: In software, when complexity is tamed there is no limit to what can be achieved. In this talk I will share the importance of modularity, why we avoided REST, and how we used messaging to build a distributed system, while keeping complete transparency across our network.

designers-hate-whitespace.title: Designers Hate Whitespace
designers-hate-whitespace.author: kennethormandy
designers-hate-whitespace.desc: Preprocessors allow us to write a more thoughtful version of our CSS, yet we rarely use ones with a whitespace sensitive syntax. This talk explores the theory designers hold dear, and the syntax they don’t.

css-element-queries.title: CSS Element Queries
css-element-queries.author: jorgepedret
css-element-queries.desc: This talk will look at how element queries will change the way we create components, techniques that we can use today and lastly show you how they fit in the big picture of web components.
